article.headline: Radford 84, Longwood 61
article.story: RADFORD, V.A. (AP) -- Chris Goodin scored 18 points and Radford used a 26-2 first-half run to make an 84-61 victory against Longwood easy on Wednesday night. The Highlanders (11-11) led 54-26 at halftime after holding the Division II Lancers to just one field goal over a span of 10 minutes during the big burst. Longwood (3-19) got 22 points from Michael Jefferson and 14 from Maurice Sumter, but shopt under 34 percent and were outrebounded 46-34. They were 7-for-27 on 3-pointers. Aaron Gill added 12 points and Kyle Zaharias and Olumuyiwa Popoola 11 for Radford.
